data.text: Hbheres Kommando z.b.V. XXXI (XXXI Corps Command) 31 This unit was formed as Grenzschutzabschnittskommando 1 (Border Security Command l) in August 1939- It participated in the campaign against Poland by occupying the Polish Corridor in September 1939 (as Korps Kaupisch from September 9)- On October 29, 1939, it was renamed the Hbheres Kommando z.b.V. XXXI. In April 19^0 the Corps took part in the occupation of Denmark and on June 2, 19UO, it left Denmark to participate in the French campaign against the Maginot Line in the Verdun area. In July 19^0 it was transferred to the Biarritz, Royan, Dax, Cognac, and Libourne areas for occupation duty, coastal defense, and security of the demarcation line. The Corps was commanded by Gen.d.Fl. Leonhard Kaupisch, from August 25, 1939- According to the Potsdam Catalog the Corps was redesignated the-LXXX. Armeekorps on May 28, Item la, Kriegstagebuch 1, Korps Kaupisch (Grenzschutzabschnittskommando l). War journal of Grenzschutzabschnittskommando 1 (Border Security Command l), as of Sep 9? 1939? known as Korps Kaupisch, relating to mobilization of the unit in Belgard, the march into and occupation of the Polish Corridor and the battle for and surrender of the naval station on the Hel Peninsula. The Corps was subordinate to AOK U, H. Gr. Nord, and Mil. Befhb. 'Danzig/Westpr., successively under the command of Gen.d.Fl.Leonhard Kaupisch. Aug 25 - Oct 3, 1939 la, Anlagen z. ICEB, Korps Kaupisch. Daily combat activity reports. Ic/AO, Anlagen z. KTB, Tatigkeitsberichte. Activity reports of the Security Officer and the Secret Police concerning their work with civilian authorities in Poland, enemy situation reports, and data on political measures taken in occupied areas. Ic/AO, Anlagen z. KTB, Nachrichten. Intelligence and enemy situation reports. Interroga- Ic/AO, Anlagen z. KTB, Vernehmungen von Gefangenen und Zivilpersonen. tion summaries of prisoners of war and civlians. Ic/AO, Anlagen z. KTB, Hela. Interrogation summaries of Polish civlians and prisoners of war about military installations in Poland. la, Sammelakte uber die Besetzung Danemarks. Material pertaining to the occupation of Denmark. Dates Aug 23 - Oct U, 1939 Aug - Sep 1939 Aug 16 - Sep 12, 1939 Aug 28 - Sep 21, 1939 Sep 16 - Oct 3, 1939 Apr 9-21, 19*10 Item No. Roll 1st Frame P ll/48b* 891 P II/U8e* 835 P II/U8f* 835 P II/U8g* 835 P Il/U8h* 835 P ii/48i* 835 E 290/1 8:5 1 1 72 652 768 871 * Items P II/U8b,e~i were badly damaged by fire.
